smartblocks.object
Interface MovingObject

All Superinterfaces:
SimulationObject
All Known Implementing Classes:
DiscMass, ObjectImpl, PunctualMass
public interface MovingObject
extends SimulationObject

Interface implemented by all objects to be used in the simulation

Author:
David FUENMAYOR

Method Summary
 void addForces(float fx, float fy, float fz)
          Adds the specified forces and torque to the "forces buffer" It doesn't actually carry out any operation on this moving object
 void applyForces(float dt)
          Applies the forces and torque added before.
 void bounce(EnumDirections direction)
          Makes this object bounce towards the specified direction
 float getAngularMomentum()
          Returns the angular momentum of this moving object
 float getAngularVelocity()
          Returns the angular velocity of the moving object in rad/s
 Vector2D getMomentum()
          Returns the momentum vector of this moving object
 float getRotation()
          Returns current angle of rotation of this object in radians
 EnumShapes getType()
          Returns the type of the object which determines its shape
 Vector2D getVelocity()
          Returns the velocity vector of the moving object
 void resetForces()
          Sets to zero the forces and the torque to be applied to this object.
 void rotate(float da)
          Rotates the object clockwise the given amount in radians
 void setMomentum(float px, float py)
          Sets momentum for this moving object
 void setMomentum(Vector2D mom)
          Sets momentum for this moving object
 void setRotation(float a)
          Sets the object to the specified angle, clockwise
 void translate(float dx, float dy)
          Translates the object the specified distance
 void updatePosition(float dt)
          Updates the values of linear and angular position according to the time interval specified and the current values of linear and angular momentum.
 
Methods inherited from interface smartblocks.simulation.SimulationObject
computeForces, getPosition, getShape, setPosition
 

Method Detail

resetForces

void resetForces()
Sets to zero the forces and the torque to be applied to this object. One can think of this forces as a buffer.

applyForces

void applyForces(float dt)
Applies the forces and torque added before. Like flushing the "forces buffer"
